intro: Chrysanthemum laciniatum, commonly known as the cutleaf chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China and Korea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely dissected, lobed leaves and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower. Chrysanthemum laciniatum is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
